moves.1. e3: HI guys, this is another annotation by me, this was played with my friend, Luke. He's okay, except for some dumb mistakes he make.
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 d5 3. Nf3 e4 4. Ne5: Whenever I have time, I send my knights up, because I think there might come a time when those pushed knights would be useful.
moves.4... Nc6 5. Bb5 Bd7: Unfortunately, that knight, I decided, was going to have a really bad day.
moves.6. Nxc6 Bxc6 7. Bxc6+ bxc6: As you can see, knight and the bishop has been traded off.
moves.9. Qg4: kinda wanted to get to g7, which would give me free rook.
moves.9... Bxc3 10. bxc3 Qf6: He saw through my tactics, and I return my focus to the four pawns that is just laying crunched up.
moves.14. c4 Rab8 15. Rab1 f5 16. cxd5: there begins the great pawn trade offs.
moves.16... cxd5 17. dxe4 dxe4: I would say pawn in f5 should have moved, because now I can check him.
moves.18. Qc4+ Rf7: That move also contributes to his doom, although his intention might have been to protect g7and c7 pawns.
moves.19. h3: This is a useful move, because knight cannot land on g4 now.
moves.19... Qb4: Got cravings for queen trade offs?
As you can see, now the queen are gone and everybody is extremely unhappy.
moves.24. d5: I moved my pawns because I wanted Luke to make the first move.
moves.24... Rb5 25. c4 Rc5: He really messed things up. a lot.
moves.26. Ba3: Luke didn't want to lose the rook, so he takes fairly costless looking pawn.
moves.27... Rf8 28. Rxf8#:
And boom goes the dynamite.

Kind of weird ending, I know. But he fell for it and I am extremely happy that he did. At least, now, one of us comes out with a smile on our face.
